name: mrsmuckles
text: A comment left by mrsmuckles was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, ezcmac, ewin, Overmedicated, StoatLad, Deusoma, SSDDR, purplehaze, TwoRightFeet, re5urgam, HSE, Connellingus, equinn2006, jollysaintpete, NDCaesar, Lumus, nipsy43, mystkmanat, ravindra108, psykeres, Dainbramage, pquinn87, morbo)

name: gouldgonewild
text: Who is Mrs. Muckles anyway?

name: mrsmuckles
text: A comment left by mrsmuckles was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ezcmac, RaysDangNachos, Overmedicated, StoatLad, Deusoma, TwoRightFeet, jollysaintpete, NDCaesar, SatelliteTV, Kennisiou, BillyLK, nipsy43, mountain, Panserbjorne)

name: lolsworth
text: I think he's some sort of robot, only lame.

name: patkun
text: The Lazarus Loafer talks like Tom Lehrer.

name: zem
text: I like Tom Lehrer but I really don't see this one

name: erinye
text:
I do. It's kind of horrifying, in a good way.

If the shoe fits...

name: pyro_ike
text: I'm not sure how you mean, but chubbied for the reference.  Now I get to read this arc with a new voice-over. :D

name: laserblade
text: How horribly imaginative.  I can actually see that.

name: deancain29
text: last panel is genius

name: centipede_damascus
text: You don't have to defend the tastiness of Old Windmill to anyone .

name: heyman
text: Absolutely least of all, one's shoe.

name: jimbob
text: Unless you've just thrown up in it.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: and it's jimbob with the exception!

name: wiliamthepleasr
text: Are we all assuming Old Windmill is a whiskey?  I mean, just so we're on the same page...

name: fineoakstructure
text: Yes.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text:
Whenever Ray's in bed like that all I can think is how hard it is to deliver bad news to Charlie Brown.
Charles Schulz Rest In Peace

name: estutius
text: RAY SMUCKLES: HE GETS THINGS DONE

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ...EXCEPT FOR WHEN HE'S DRANK TOO MUCH OLD WINDMILL!

name: dybrar
text:
He even gets the not getting things done done.

(I contemplated adding a comma, but decided against it. I had to write it, now you have to parse it.)

name: plummet
text: Next time I have to get up early with a hangover I'll mention the possibility of Stage One Renal Failure if I blink.

name: androo
text: This is the second time Ray tries to "skip a day" after Roast Beef was trying to wake him up, I think when he made pickles.

name: tim_simmons
text: Shut up Lazarus! best response ever to a demon shoe.

name: gethen
text: alt text ... so beautiful *sob*

name: erinye
text:
(for reference for those too lazy to hover)

"The cat is having an argument with his powerful shoe."

name: songbirdspectre
text: i love it when the alt text makes it a 5.

name: iseedeadpixels
text:
I completely forgot that line was from achewood.
Me drunk at three in the morning, "Guinness is tasty ! I ain't got to defend that to you!"
Might have some Old Windmill tonight, what is it about achewood that brings out the consumer in me?

name: snowman
text: consumer = alcoholic

name: iseedeadpixels
text: shhhhh ... my family might hear...

name: irondave
text: It really sucks that earlier today my wife looked in the pantry and asked me "Why are you drinking Rye.?"  My response was not a direct quote of this strip BECAUSE I HAD NOT YET READ THIS STRIP AT THAT TIME!  Damn the luck.

name: em2
text:
Ray?
Ray, I'm a prostitute.

name: deusoma
text: I deeply enjoy sending this strip to people who don't know anything about Achewood, completely without context.

name: desert_donkey
text:
NICE!! i just read back-to-back hangover "skippin' a day" achewood's.

5!

name: cpnglxynchos
text: DOUBLE-SWEET

name: dj_douche
text: Ray's immense wealth comes despite most of his business decisions, not because of them. Taking Lazarus' biz-school advice would screw with the formula irreparably.
